title: More Than a Secretary
descriptions:
In 1936's "More Than a Secretary," the film follows the story of a young secretary named Carol Baldwin who works for a successful businessman named David Marshall. Despite her position as his secretary, Carol is ambitious and determined to prove herself in a male-dominated workplace. As Carol works tirelessly to assist David with his business affairs, she also finds herself falling in love with him.

David, however, is oblivious to Carol's feelings and sees her only as his efficient secretary. When a rival businesswoman sets her sights on David and begins to pursue him, Carol must find a way to show David her true feelings before it's too late.

As Carol navigates the challenges of her personal and professional life, she must confront societal expectations and gender norms that threaten to keep her in a subordinate role. With the help of her friends and colleagues, Carol learns to stand up for herself and fight for her place in the business world.

"More Than a Secretary" is a heartwarming tale of love, ambition, and empowerment set against the backdrop of 1930s corporate America. The film explores themes of gender equality, workplace dynamics, and the power of self-confidence. With a mix of romance, humor, and drama, "More Than a Secretary" is a timeless classic that continues to resonate with audiences today.
